article.title: Raytheon to Support AIM-9X for Saudi Arabia
article.author: George I. Seffers
article.text: Raytheon Missile Systems, Tucson, Ariz., is being awarded an $8,627,879 modification to a previously awarded cost-plus-fixed-fee contract services in support of the Phase II AIM-9X System Improvement Program for the U.S. Air Force, Navy, and the government of Saudi Arabia, including hardware and software development activities and implementation of security architecture requirements. The Naval Air Systems Command, Patuxent River, Md., is the contracting activity.
